creator: thorsten@apache.org
text:
I did:
- Log into default as alice
- go to the sitetree, select Tutorial
- select menu Submit, then menu Publish
- select publish entire subtree, deselect notify submitter
- the doc Tutorial is live, but not the subtree "Create new doctype"

Further after you did the above procedure you cannot publish the subtree
document "Create new doctype" anymore. You need to review it and then accept it.

Deactivating the whole tree is working fine.

IIUC this is the normal behaviour:

- you submit "/tutorial" (this is not recursive)
- "/tutorial" is in review state
- "/tutorial/new_doctype" is still in authoring state

- you publish the subtree
- "/tutorial" is published, because it was in review state
- "/tutorial/new_doctype" is *not* published, because it was in authoring state

Would you mind clarifying what you consider a bug? Thanks!
creator: andreas@apache.org
thorsten@apache.org
text:
I did the following after reading your comment:
- submit "/tutorial" and afterward "/tutorial/new_doctype" for review
--"/tutorial" is in review state
--"/tutorial/new_doctype" is in review state

Published and both are live. 
http://lenya.zones.apache.org:9999/default/authoring/tutorial.html?lenya.usecase=tab.overview

But even if this is the default behavior we may consider to 
- allow submit the whole "/tutorial" tree recursive to the review state
otherwise you have to go to all the underlying documents by one and submit them
which makes the publish whole tree kind of risible.
